Description: Plate 6: The Flight into Egypt. The Virgin seated on a donkey with Christ at right, St Joseph holding some tools and guiding the donkey at left; letterpress on verso; after Anthonis Sallaert; illustration to Judocus Andries' "Perpetua Crux sive Passio Jesu Christi" (Antwerp: 1649) Woodcut
Producer name: Print made by: Jan Christoffel Jegher
Curator's comments: This is one from a series of forty book-illustrations, for comment see 1919,0616.66.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1-40)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Capt Edward G Spencer-Churchill
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: John Rushout, 2nd Baron Northwick
Acquisition notes: 1919,0616.1 to 133 were all purchased from Captain Spencer-Churchill at Northwick Park through his solicitors, Messrs Johnson, Raymond-Barker Co, for a total of £655. The collection had been formed by John Rushout, 2nd Baron Northwick in the 1820s, and had descended to Captain Spencer-Churchill. The earlier provenance of many of the prints is recorded in individual catalogue records.
